Class Library

java.lang.Object
Library
public class Library
extends java.lang.Object

    static int bookNums  
    private Book[] books  
    private int CAPACITY  
    private int numBooks  
    int serialNum  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Library()
    The default constructor called to create an empty book array (a.k.a.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void add​(Book book)
    This method allows users to add books into our book array and also gives that book a serial number of 10001 or greater.
    boolean checkOut​(Book book)
    This method allows users to check out a book.
    private int find​(Book book)
    A helper method to find a book within the book array.
    private void grow()
    A helper method that helps grow the book array by a capacity of 4.
    void print()
    This method allows the user, once the PA command is called through Kiosk, to print the library's contents in the order they were placed.
    void printByDate()
    This method allows the user, once the PD command is called through Kiosk, to print the library's books by date (datePublished) in ascending order.
    void printByNumber()
    This method allows the user, once the PN command is called through Kiosk, to print the library's books by their serial numbers in ascending order.
    boolean remove​(Book book)
    This method permanently removes a book from our book array.
    boolean returns​(Book book)
    Allows the user to return a book after they have checked it out.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • books

      private Book[] books

    • numBooks

      private int numBooks

    • CAPACITY

      private int CAPACITY

    • bookNums

      public static int bookNums

    • serialNum

      public int serialNum

  • Constructor Details

    • Library

      public Library()
      The default constructor called to create an empty book array (a.k.a. library).

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(Book book)
      A helper method to find a book within the book array.
      Parameters:
      book - of type Book to find a book within the book array.
      Returns:
      the location of the book in the book array.

    • grow

      private void grow()
      A helper method that helps grow the book array by a capacity of 4.

    • add

      public void add​(Book book)
      This method allows users to add books into our book array and also gives that book a serial number of 10001 or greater. It also increments the variable that represents the number of books in our array.
      Parameters:
      book - of type Book being added into library

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Book book)
      This method permanently removes a book from our book array. If a book has already been removed from the library, it cannot be removed again. It also decrements the variable representing the number of books contained in the array.
      Parameters:
      book - of type Book being removed from library
      Returns:
      boolean to true if the book can be removed, false otherwise

    • checkOut

      public boolean checkOut​(Book book)
      This method allows users to check out a book. It is similar to remove in the sense that only a book that was added in the library can be taken and also once a book is taken, it cannot be taken again. However, once it is returned it can be taken.
      Parameters:
      book - of type Book whose status we must change to not available
      Returns:
      boolean true if successfully being checked out, false otherwise

    • returns

      public boolean returns​(Book book)
      Allows the user to return a book after they have checked it out. Similar to add, and actually calls add to have book back in the library.
      Parameters:
      book - of type Book whose status we want to change to is available
      Returns:
      boolean true if it is being successfully returned, false if it's still available

    • print

      public void print()
      This method allows the user, once the PA command is called through Kiosk, to print the library's contents in the order they were placed.

    • printByDate

      public void printByDate()
      This method allows the user, once the PD command is called through Kiosk, to print the library's books by date (datePublished) in ascending order.

    • printByNumber

      public void printByNumber()
      This method allows the user, once the PN command is called through Kiosk, to print the library's books by their serial numbers in ascending order.
